sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)
articles.description: When writing front-end tests, you‚Äôll find a lot of pitfalls along the way. In sum, they can lead to lousy maintainability, slow execution time, and ‚Äî in the worst case ‚Äî tests you cannot trust. But it doesn‚Äôt have to be that way. In this article, I will talk about common mistakes developers make, at least in my experience, and, of course, how to avoid them. Testing doesn‚Äôt need to be painful, after all.
articles.title: It‚Äôs A (Front-End Testing) Trap! Six Common Testing Pitfalls And How To Solve Them

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Surma)
articles.description: The web is single-threaded. This makes it increasingly hard to write smooth and responsive apps. Workers have a bad rep, but can be an important and useful tool in any web developer's toolbelt for these kinds of problems. Let‚Äôs get up to speed on Workers on the Web!
articles.title: The State Of Web Workers In 2021

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs welcome July with some fresh desktop wallpapers. Designed by artists and designers from around the world, they are available with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: The Many Shades Of July (2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (√Åtila Fassina)
articles.description: Static Generation is great for performance ‚Äî until the app gets too big and build-times go through the roof. Today, we‚Äôll have a look at how Netlify‚Äôs fresh On-Demand Builders can fix that.
articles.title: Breaking Down Bulky Builds With Netlify And Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we‚Äôre talking about Chakra UI. What is it and how can it help with your React projects? Drew McLellan talks to expert Mike Cavaliere to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 40 Mike Cavaliere: What Is Chakra UI For React?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Manuel Matuzoviƒá)
articles.description: In this article, Manuel explains why Emmet is one of his favorite productivity tools for writing HTML and CSS, and how you can create custom Emmet snippets in Visual Studio Code to help you improve your front-end workflows even more.
articles.title: Creating Custom Emmet Snippets In VS Code

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dom Habersack)
articles.description: This article explains how we can connect different types of content in a Next.js application. With this technique, we can add any kind of one-to-one, one-to-many, or even many-to-many relationship to our projects.
articles.title: Creating A Multi-Author Blog With Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mark Lankmilier)
articles.description: This article is a case study of how a UX audit affects a UI. It explains how a famous educational platform can be analyzed edX against Jakob Nielsen‚Äôs usability guidelines. To get started, Mark Lankmiller shares all of the criteria and metrics he used for his UX audit.
articles.title: How To Run A UX Audit For A Major EdTech Platform (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Josh Singer)
articles.description: In the dynamic and unpredictable environments in which we work, even the most carefully crafted solutions can have a short shelf life. When we accept that our work is impermanent and our problem-solving abilities are limited, our goal can shift from delivering full solutions to developing tools that empower our users to adaptively design for themselves.
articles.title: The Rise Of Design Thinking As A Problem Solving Strategy

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris Lje≈°njanin)
articles.description: Frontend and design are remarkably complex these days. That‚Äôs why we invite kind, smart folks from the community to run [online workshops](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/) for all of us to learn together. And we have new ones coming up, and we‚Äôd like to kindly welcome you to join in.
articles.title: Smashing Online Workshops (July-October 2021)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cameron Cundiff)
articles.description: Automated testing is an important part of any software project, including testing for accessibility. There are already tools for linting and integration testing accessibility, but what about end-to-end testing with real assistive technology? Since I hadn‚Äôt seen this before, I set out to build Auto VO, a driver for the VoiceOver screen reader.
articles.title: Automating Screen Reader Testing On macOS Using Auto VO

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Miko≈Çaj Dobrucki)
articles.description: After years of innovation in both tools and processes, the struggle between design and development is still real. This article focuses on the best practices for improving the design to development processes and how cutting-edge solutions, such as UXPin powered by Merge technology, can help in facilitating the change.
articles.title: Designing With Code: A Modern Approach To Design (Development Challenges)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ayobami Ogundiran)
articles.description: Do you have to process data manually because it is served through images or scanned documents? An image-to-text conversion makes it possible to extract text from images to automate the processing of texts on images, videos, and scanned documents. In this article, we look at how to convert an image to text with React and Tesseract.js(OCR), preprocess images, and deal with the limitations of Tesseract (OCR).
articles.title: Image To Text Conversion With React And Tesseract.js (OCR)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ottomatias Peura)
articles.description: Voice assistants are currently the most popular use case for voice user interfaces. However, due to the bad feedback loop resulting from voice assistants can only solve simple user tasks such as setting an alarm or playing music. In order for voice user interfaces to really break through, feedback to the user must be visual, not auditive.
articles.title: An Alternative Voice UI To Voice Assistants

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adebiyi Adedotun)
articles.description: Next.js has a file-based routing system in which each page automatically becomes a route based on its file name. This article will guide you through almost everything you need to know about Routing in Next.js and point you in the direction of related topics and concepts.
articles.title: Client-Side Routing In Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Bailey)
articles.description: Image placement on the modern web is highly intentional, helping to communicate the overall purpose of a page or view. This means that nearly every image you declare needs to have an alternate description.
articles.title: Your Image Is Probably Not Decorative

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nic Chan)
articles.description: In a new short series of posts, we highlight some of the useful tools and techniques for developers and designers. Recently we‚Äôve covered HTML Emails and SVG Generators. This time we look into different kinds of tools to help you streamline your accessibility testing process. Don‚Äôt miss the next one.
articles.title: A Complete Guide To Accessibility Tooling

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: When developing themes and plugins for WordPress, we need to test them in different environments. How can we create multiple testing sites on our computer, quickly and easily, without having to become a sysadmin?
articles.title: Spinning Up Multiple WordPress Sites Locally With DevKinsta

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we‚Äôre talking about image optimization. What steps should we follow for performant images in 2021? We talk to expert Addy Osmani to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 39 With Addy Osmani: Image Optimization

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Eckles)
articles.description: Spoiler alert: tooltips, modals, tabs, carousels, and dropdown menus are some of the user interface components that require more than CSS. To ensure accessibility of your interface, JavaScript is a necessary addition to accomplish focus management, respond to keyboard events, and toggle ARIA attributes.
articles.title: When CSS Isn‚Äôt Enough: JavaScript Requirements For Accessible Components

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederick O‚ÄôBrien)
articles.description: Design often revolves around visuals, but the other senses deserve love too. In this article, we tune in to audio features that are making sites sing.
articles.title: Web Design Done Well: Making Use Of Audio

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: We don‚Äôt need to write everything from scratch every single time. With boilerplates and starter kits, we can set up our projects faster, and get to work immediately.
articles.title: Useful Front-End Boilerplates And Starter Kits

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stefan Judis)
articles.description: Building a faster website can be a rocket task these days. There are so many things to consider, so it‚Äôs challenging to get everything right. Here are some less-known tools that might help you get there.
articles.title: Three Front-End Auditing Tools I Discovered Recently

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: What makes relational selector one of the most requested features and how are we, as developers, working around not having it? In this article, we‚Äôre going to check the early spec of the :has selector, and see how it should improve the CSS workflow once it‚Äôs released.
articles.title: Meet :has, A Native CSS Parent Selector (And More)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: It‚Äôs here! For the last year, we‚Äôve been working with Addy Osmani on a new Smashing Book all around image optimization. And now it‚Äôs here. Meet ‚ÄúImage Optimization‚Äù, our deep-dive guide to understand how to deliver high-quality images on the web fast.
articles.title: From AVIF to WebP: A New Smashing Book By Addy Osmani

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Prince Chukwudire)
articles.description: In this guide, we‚Äôll be taking a general look at the concepts of forward geocoding and reverse geocoding, and will build a mini-app that applies these concepts to display specific locations, using Mapbox and Vue.js 2.6.11 to achieve this.
articles.title: How To Build A Geocoding App In Vue.js Using Mapbox

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nwani Victory)
articles.description: Modern browsers provide good support for JavaScript modules, but module bundlers such as webpack stay a critical part of the JavaScript toolchain. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into what webpack is and how to use it in your development workflow.
articles.title: Getting Started With Webpack

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Shawn Wildermuth)
articles.description: Writing large-scale Vue applications can be a challenge. In this article, Shawn Wildermuth dives into the pros and cons of approaches like factories, shared objects, and using Vuex. He also explains what is coming in Vuex 5.0 that might change how we all use shared state in Vue 3.
articles.title: Managing Shared State In Vue 3

articles.description: In this article, I'm going to show you how to theme your website so users can customize certain elements to their tastes.  We'll talk about website themes, how theming works, and we'll end with a demo so you can see it in action. Let's dive in. Table of Contents:What
articles.title: What is Website Theming? How to Use CSS Custom Properties and Gatsby.js to Customize Your Site

articles.description: Listing items on a web page is a common task you'll have to do as a web developer. You may have to list shopping cart items, the order of students based on their grades, dogs with the loudest bark ‚Äì and so on. So you need to know the different ways
articles.title: HTML List ‚Äì How to Use Bullet Points, Ordered, and Unordered Lists

We just published a full backend web development with Python course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. This comprehensive course is for

And I'm thrilled

articles.title: Learn the CSS Box-Shadow Property by Coding a Beautiful Button ‚ú®

articles.description: This tutorial is an overview of basic concepts of the C programming language.  It goes over the history of the language, why and where it is used, the compilation process, and some very basic programming concepts that are common in most popular programming languages. It is not a complete guide
articles.title: What is The C Programming Language? A Tutorial for Beginners

articles.description: React Router is commonly used to make different routes for pages in React Applications. We just released a crash course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to create routes in your React applications. Piyush Agarwal developed this course. Piyush is a prolific course creator on
articles.title: Learn React Router

articles.description: Whether you are new to coding interviews or are already familiar with the concept of backtracking, this is the crash course for you. We will learn about an all-purpose coding template and apply it to two LeetCode hard problems. Ready to crunch your next coding interview? Let's go!
articles.title: Coding Interview Backtracking Problems Crash Course ‚Äì The Only One You'll Ever Need

articles.description: Every day, developers use various applications and run commands in the terminal. These applications can include a browser, code editor, terminal, video conferencing app, or music player.  For each of these software applications that you open or commands you run, it creates a process or task. One beautiful feature of
articles.title: Linux List Processes ‚Äì How to Check Running Processes

articles.description: Why do we need the timedelta object?When you're working with dates and times in Python, you'll often use the datetime module.  In this post, we'll see how we can use the timedelta object in the datetime module. It denotes a span of time and can help when we need
